boat.name: Grace
boat.full_description:
Ferro-cement hull built by Windboats of Wroxham to John Perryman's Norske 35 design based on Colin Archer lifeboats. Understood to have been home completed over a long period of time during which it is believed she changed hands, launching as 'Sujo' about 1987 on the East Coast of England where she was used for sail training.

In about 2000 she changed hands and moved to the English South Coast and cruised to France, Spain and Portugal. Changing hands again in 2005 she was re-named 'Grace'.

Following a refit in 2008 she cruised to South Brittany and was kept there for four seasons, returning to UK waters in 2013, being berthed in Exmouth.

She has returned to her French home port of La Roche Bernard.
boat.construction_details: Ferro cement: seacrete/GRP decks and superstructure
boat.short_description: 'Grace' is a Norske 35 gaff cutter designed by John Perryman on the lines of a Colin Archer sailing lifeboat, originally named 'Sujo'.
